definition: both sides are willing/by mutual consent
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)

sentences.english: Wu had said that whatever occurred was consensual.
sentences.chinese: 吴说，无论发生是两厢情愿。

sentences.english: However, an article in the Shanghai Business Daily commented that Coca-Cola's purchase of Huiyuan was a deal struck of the wills of both sides.
sentences.chinese: 可口可乐收购汇源果汁，是一笔两厢情愿的交易。

sentences.english: He acknowledges that sex took place but i ists it was coe ual.
sentences.chinese: 他承认有发生性行为，但坚持是两厢情愿的。

definition: (of a couple) to be harmonious/to be each other's sunshine
both sides are willing/by mutual consent
to have an affinity with each other (idiom)/to find each other congenial

lit. if you have to use force to break a melon off the vine, it won't taste sweet (because it's only when the melon is ripe that it can be removed with just a slight twist) (idiom)/fig. if sth is not meant to be, it's no use trying to force it to happen
pinyin: qiang3 niu3 de5 gua1 bu4 tian2

definition: lit. one palm alone cannot clap (proverb)/fig. it takes two persons to start a dispute/it takes two to tango/it's difficult to achieve anything without support
pinyin: yi1 ge5 ba1 zhang3 pai1 bu4 xiang3

definition: to make a pledge to be married, without parents' approval
a couple in a short-lived, improper relationship
to part without hard feelings (idiom)/to cut the knot as smoothly as you tied it
